The correct chronological order is option C: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 6 -> 5.
Firstly, he starts by stating that Ionos and Nextcloud share the same vision of European data sovereignty (Event 1). Then, a slide appears with the statement "IONOS and 1&1 share the same vision" (Event 2), which confirms the shared vision.
After that, a world map slide is shown, highlighting statistics such as >25 million domains and >100,000 servers (Event 3).
He then announces that they now offer Kubernetes as a managed service (Event 4).
Finally, the blue poster "What we guarantee our customers" with five categories takes over the screen (Event 5). Lastly, he introduces an enterprise-grade Nextcloud on IONOS with unlimited storage and user seats (Event 6).

Therefore, the events are presented in the following order: ionos and nextcloud share the same vision -> slide appears -> world map slide -> kubernetes as a managed service -> blue poster -> enterprise-grade nextcloud on ionos.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on cloud computing for help. The speech starts with InfiniBand at the network level, followed by contributions to open-source software, which leads to the Nextcloud partnership. Then he describes an enterprise-grade Nextcloud on IONOS with unlimited storage and user seats. A slide appears with "COMING SOON" for private and SMB customers, and then he highlights a fully managed Nextcloud for everyone addressing work-from-home needs during the COVID-19 pandemic. Finally, he invites questions and closes the presentation with a slide saying "This is just the beginning...".

Therefore, the answer is (B).
